data.name: Oxford Medical Simulation
data.description:
At Oxford Medical Simulation (OMS), we deliver immersive, virtual reality clinical experiences on-demand. Our clinically-led approach creates rich, complex scenarios allowing healthcare professionals to learn from experience: practicing more, making fewer mistakes and improving patient care.

Learners are immersed in clinical environments with dynamic, engaging virtual patients in true-to-life clinical scenarios, independent of faculty facilitation. Learners can see multiple patients, conversing, assessing, managing, and engaging with interdisciplinary teams. Learners receive a guided debrief, automated, intelligent feedback, performance metrics, and blended learning. 

OMS offers a wide range of standardized, repeatable, flexible, faculty-free scenarios. From ED, med-surg, OB, mental health, and peds to procedures, communication skills, and advanced cardiac life support codes, choose from over 200 scenarios that can be used in VR and on-screen.

changelog.change_log: - Fixed bug where the EFM strip image count, timestamp, and X to close were not visible. These are now all visible and interactable.

- Fix for getting stuck after giving shock in SAL001UK/US and ALS001UK/US
- Fix for Defib screen sizing in on-screen play
- Fix for extra pop-up messages in MKS001US
- Fix for missing anaphylaxis guideline in SNP006US
- Improvement to draw order of character hair vs image/menu UI
- Feedback re-uploaded to enable Competency Mapping and Tracking functionality
- Fix for a few robot voices
- Addition of wristbands, verification of name and date of birth, and 5 Rights Feedback in SNO and SNP libraries
- Sepsis scenario alignment with current guidance
- Updating select references to Surviving Sepsis 2021
-- Changing wording related to 'Urine output and fluid balance'
-- Updating Catheter feedback to Neutral and changing wording - will match the above but have an additional sentence which reads "Remember you should only insert a catheter if you feel confident it is indicated and have the correct competencies to do so."
-- Updating IV fluids feedback wording
-- Updating when certain pieces of feedback appear to better align with the actual feedback
-- Cleaned up when the feedback "Urine output and fluid balance" appear - there were some actions missing in this one
- SMH Improvements
-- Additional communication option to ask permission to examine. Feedback is given based on whether the learner asked permission to examine
-- Addition of audio for sensitive questioning around abuse
-- SMH001US has been renamed Acute Anxiety to better reflect patient history
-- Review of auto-generated scorecards for functionality in our mental health scenarios
- SNO003US changes
-- Physiology parameters for blood pressure to focus scenario on Gestational Hypertension complicated by Non-Insulin Dependent Diabetes Mellitus (NIDDM)
-- Gestational age changed to 32 weeks to depict a pregnant patient less likely to give concern around timing of delivery
-- MgSO4 4 g IV bolus (then 2g/hr) has now been denoted as unindicated
-- Fix for missing sepsis guideline
